cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 55 mi SE of Naples, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across the Gulf of Mexico toward the north-central Gulf Coast (southern MS/SE LA)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast (likely Mississippi or southeast Louisiana)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Ochlockonee River to Okaloosa/Walton County Line (Florida Panhandle)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida west-central coast, Florida Panhandle, Alabama, Mississippi, southeast Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Only a slight chance (≤6%) of tropical-storm-force (≥34 kt) winds; most likely breezy with occasional gusts below gale-force.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Georgia coast from this system.
weather_observation.rainfall: Minor outer-band rainfall possible, generally less than 2 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated rip-current risk along Georgia and northeast Florida beaches.
